apple.description: The apple is a crisp, sweet fruit commonly eaten raw or used in desserts.

orange.description: The orange is a juicy citrus fruit rich in vitamin C, often eaten fresh or juiced.

coke_soda.description: Coke soda is a popular carbonated drink known for its classic cola flavor.

tea_lipton.description: Tea Lipton is a packaged tea product commonly brewed as a warm, soothing beverage.

cookies.description: Cookies are sweet baked treats often enjoyed as snacks or desserts.

chips.description: Chips are thin, crispy slices of potato or similar snack food, typically salted and crunchy.

banana.description: The banana is a soft, sweet fruit with a yellow peel, commonly eaten raw.

cereal.description: Cereal is a dry, processed food usually eaten with milk for a quick breakfast or snack.

fork.description: A fork is a utensil with prongs used to spear and lift food while eating.

spoon.description: A spoon is a rounded utensil used to scoop and eat soft or liquid foods.

bowl.description: A bowl is a deep, round dish used to hold and serve food such as soup or cereal.

tenis_ball.description: The tenis ball is a soft, bouncy ball used for playing tennis or other sports.
